p: Normotensive rats were anesthetized using thiopental (70–90 mg/kg), and blood pressure was measured using the direct surgical method as described earlier. Different groups of rats were given hexamethonium bromide (30 mg/kg), atropine (1 mg/kg), captopril (2.5 mg/kg), indomethacin (5 mg/kg), L-NAME (20 mg/kg), and propranolol (100 mg/kg), 10 min prior to AS-AT (25 mg/kg, i.v) administration. Change in blood pressure was documented for 45 min postdosing [ 19].
